review: As of this posting, Tabcasting (non optimized pages) works, even though its in Beta. If you want to throw a stream to the tv you can. Optimized sites(like Youtube) have some UI changes. You need 0 computer expertise, just a proficiency in following directions and mouse usage. The install instructions that are part of the packaging has 3 steps. Spoiler alert! 1. plug in the power and the dongle (comes with a small hdmi extension). 2. switch the input on your tv. 3.. go to the website and follow directions. the dongle and computer did everything, no need to put in the full 20+ wifi pass, no need to forward ports.this is not a dongle that has app functionality like amazon fire or roku. this is to throw w/e u have on your chrome screen(i wish it screen cast) to the tv to share with the room. you know, in the movies when u see the tech person gesture with their hand when they 'throw' their screen to a bigger one so they can all see the info? this is what that does (minus the cool gesturing, but i've still tried to pull off the look).TL;DRWorks Out of the Boxheadache free installation (assuming u have access to the hdmi port on tv and a free power port.)reason it exists: "Hey Significant Human(s) in my life, I have media from the internet I would like to view/share with you." Response from those Significant Humans: "After, we watch what i want! (and everyone in the room can take turns, since they are all on the same wifi network)"
